title: python help
author: t2_zyj2d
text:
hi all,

I am trying to import a .csv file and filter the results into a new one using python. Here is my code so far:

import pandas as pd

​

df = pd.read\_csv('PIREPS\_201908161600.csv')

df\['flight level'\]

df.columns

new\_df = df.loc(df\['flight level'\] < 100)

new\_df.reset\_index(drop=True, inplace=True)

new\_df

new\_df.to\_csv('filtered.csv')

​

So basically under the flight level column I want it to filter any values over 100 out and leave only the remaining rows left, I keep getting this error: TypeError: 'Series' objects are mutable, thus they cannot be hashed and do not know how to proceed.

TIA
